title: Physics-Informed GCN-LSTM Framework for Long-Term Forecasting of 2D and 3D Microstructure Evolution
summary: This paper presents a physics-informed framework integrating graph convolutional networks (GCN) with long short-term memory (LSTM) to forecast microstructure evolution over long time horizons in both 2D and 3D. The framework is composition-aware, trained jointly on datasets with different compositions, and operates in latent graph space, capturing compositions and morphological dynamics.
usefulness_reason: The summary mentions "microstructure evolution over long time horizons in both 2D and 3D", which directly implies a spatio-temporal aspect. The use of GCN and LSTM for forecasting further supports the relevance to spatio-temporal data analysis.
